snippet: An independent inquiry contradicting the official account has renewed parents’ hopes and has brought new cynicism into the public’s perceptions of its leaders.
abstract: International report challenging Mexican government's formal explanation of 2014 disappearance of 43 student teachers in town of Ayotzinapa has fostered both hope and cynicism in citizens and engendered calls for government to respond; officials have been accused of ignoring country's security issues in favor of spin campaign focused on economic growth, and apparent willingness of some within Pres Enrique Pena Nieto's office to admit failings marks significant attitude shift.
lead_paragraph: An independent inquiry contradicting the official account has renewed parents’ hopes and has brought new cynicism into the public’s perceptions of its leaders.

headline.main: Report Renews Hope and Doubt on Missing Students in Mexico
headline.print_headline: Report Renews Hope and Doubt on Missing Students in Mexico
